title: PD: Missing Norwalk man found ‘safe and sound’
content: Photo: Contributed Photo / Norwalk Police Department      Image 1 of / 1      Caption    Close         Image  1  of  1    Photo: Contributed Photo / Norwalk Police Department Back to Gallery        UPDATE:    “We have located Mr. Santiago safe and sound,” said Lt. Terry Blake at 5 p.m. “Silver Alert is canceled.”    Original story:    NORWALK — Police are looking for a missing man from Norwalk Saturday afternoon and ask that anyone who sees him to call 911 immediately.    A Silver Alert was issued around 4:45 p.m. for 72-year-old Felipe Santiago. Police said Santiago is a bald Latino man who stands about 5 feet, 10 inches tall and weighs about 150 pounds.    Santiago was last seen wearing a blue baseball hat, a yellow short-sleeve shirt, blue pants and gray sneakers. He was last seen around 2 p.m. near Kendall School on Fillow Street.    Police said Santiago suffers from Alzheimer’s Disease.
